title: Jun-Ichi Igusa
text:
was a Japanese <a href="mathematician">mathematician</a> who for over three decades was on the faculty at <a href="Johns%20Hopkins%20University">Johns Hopkins University</a>. He is known for his contributions to <a href="algebraic%20geometry">algebraic geometry</a> and <a href="number%20theory">number theory</a>. The <a href="Igusa%20zeta-function">Igusa zeta-function</a>, the <a href="Igusa%20quartic">Igusa quartic</a>, <a href="Igusa%20subgroup">Igusa subgroup</a>s, <a href="Igusa%20curve">Igusa curve</a>s, and <a href="Igusa%20varieties">Igusa varieties</a> are named after him.
He was an invited speaker for the 1962 <a href="International%20Congress%20of%20Mathematicians">International Congress of Mathematicians</a> in <a href="Stockholm">Stockholm</a>. He was awarded Japan's <a href="Order%20of%20the%20Sacred%20Treasure">Order of the Sacred Treasure</a>. In 2012 he became a fellow of the <a href="American%20Mathematical%20Society">American Mathematical Society</a>.
Life and career.
Igusa was born in Kiyosato village, <a href="Gunma%20Prefecture">Gunma Prefecture</a>, Japan, on 30 January 1924. He graduated from the <a href="University%20of%20Tokyo">University of Tokyo</a> in 1945 and received his <a href="Ph.D.">Ph.D.</a> from <a href="Kyoto%20University">Kyoto University</a> in 1953, after which he became professor of mathematics at the <a href="University%20of%20Tsukuba">University of Tsukuba</a>. After a brief period spent at <a href="Harvard%20University">Harvard University</a>, he took up a permanent position at Johns Hopkins University, in <a href="Baltimore">Baltimore</a>. Igusa taught at Johns Hopkins from 1955 to 1993. He joined the staff of the "<a href="American%20Journal%20of%20Mathematics">American Journal of Mathematics</a>" as an associate editor in 1964, and served as chief editor between 1978 and 1993. Igusa died, aged 89, of a stroke at Holly Hill Nursing Home in <a href="Towson%2C%20Maryland">Towson, Maryland</a>, on 24 November 2013.
He had three sons, Kiyoshi, Takeru and Mitsuru. Takeru Igusa is a professor of civil engineering at <a href="Johns%20Hopkins%20University">Johns Hopkins University</a>. <a href="Kiyoshi%20Igusa">Kiyoshi Igusa</a> is a professor of mathematics at <a href="Brandeis%20University">Brandeis University</a>.
